meanings.definition: prosers (noun): individuals who engage in writing or speaking in a dull or tedious manner
meanings.sent1: The prosers in the meeting made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the prosers in the literary circle.
meanings.sent3: The prosers at the library always put people to sleep with their long speeches.
meanings.sent4: The prosers' words were like a never-ending lullaby, soothing but never exciting.
meanings.sent5: Avoiding the prosers at the party was a challenge, as they always cornered you for a chat.

meanings.definition: prosers (verb): to engage in writing or speaking in a dull or tedious manner
meanings.sent1: He prosers on about the same topic every time we meet.
meanings.sent2: Please don't prosers during the presentation; keep it engaging.
meanings.sent3: The teacher warned the students not to prosers during their speeches.
meanings.sent4: Her words prosers like a slow drip of water, monotonous and unending.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech prosers on, losing the interest of the audience with each passing minute.
